posts.post_content:
@robbinhood [Goliath sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goliath sphinx) is a good card to play but the luck of any kind of protection is really important if you play against serious constructed decks. If you play a sphinx for 7 mana and you dont have 2 spare lands for a counter you will probably end up with a removed from the game sphinx with 7 mana tapped for nothing before your turn is over... So you actually need to have 9 mana for the sphinx, thats why Inkwell is a much much better deal, the fact that it has overshadowed [darksteel colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=darksteel colossus ) , a heavy played card in many artifact decks proves leviathan's value in play.  
  
@bpmbrent you cant target a creature with shroud so rite of replication won't work

posts.post_content:
It really is this or the [Darksteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Colossus).  
Tough choice.  
The Iron man has Indestrucability, but that only causes him to be [Path of Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path of Exile)d, or [Oblivion Ring](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oblivion Ring)ed. This guy has a soild toughness, and can't be the target of spells or abilities and has an evasion ability to boot, if you use [Convincing Mirage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Convincing Mirage).  
Real tough choice.
posts.html:

Posted By: John-Bender (4/9/2010 3:20:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: It's the Giant Licorice Monster!!! This dude is heavy, but for 2 less mana, you could throw out a 8/7 Goliath Sphinx with flying instead. Flying is superior to trample in my opinion (trample almost always runs into a blocker). Your Goliath can take down a Baneslayer and deal 8 damage a turn to your opponent compared to the 4 or 3 damage your Inkwell is probably going to cause. And good night, you're playing blue, so you should be able to counter your opponent's removal attempts on your Goliath. Don't overpay for the "removal insurance" on the Inkwell!
posts.html:
It's the Giant Licorice Monster!!! This dude is heavy, but for 2 less mana, you could throw out a 8/7 Goliath Sphinx with flying instead. Flying is superior to trample in my opinion (trample almost always runs into a blocker).
